document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genera Acrosathe Irwin and Lyneborg, Arenigena Irwin and Lyneborg, and Litolinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) from the Nearctic Region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genera Acrosathe Irwin and Lyneborg, Arenigena Irwin and Lyneborg, and Litolinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) from the Nearctic Region

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
otiosa Coquillett (1893a:197
key, 199 male desc., 200 fem. desc.),
Aldrich (1905:248
, cat.),
Kröber (1912: 248
male key, 250 fem. key, 255 spec. list, 257 desc; 1913: 43 male key, 44 fem. key, 60 dist.),
Cole (1923a: 87
male key, 88 fem. key, 93 diag., dist., Figs. 124 fem. frons, 141 ant., 167 wing; 1965:354, cat.) (
Thereva
);
Irwin and Lyneborg (1981a:225
comb. change, spec. list),
Holston (2004:59
nom.) (
Acrosathe
). Type locality USA , California , Los Angeles County. Lectotype male in USNM.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The male of
Acrosathe otiosa
is similar to
A. vanduzeei
in having the wing veins and cross-veins with a dark brown margin. It is separated from
A. vanduzeei
in having the setae on male sternite 8 absent medially on posterior margin ( Fig. 19 ); the AAP ventral view narrow, sides sinuate ( Fig. 23 ), lateral view ( Fig. 24 ) elongate, almost extending to apex of distiphallus; and the ventral apodeme ( Fig. 23 ) reaching anterior margin of dorsal apodeme. The female of
A. otiosa
is similar to
A. bimaculata
and
A. vialis
in having the frons with two round, dark brown to black pubescent circles (as in Fig. 7 ). It differs from
A. bimaculata
and
A. vialis
in having the wing veins and cross-veins with a dark brown margin. The furca ( Fig. 25 ) of
A. otiosa
differs from
A. bimaculata
in being oval with the anterior and posterior margins rounded. The furca ( Fig. 25 ) of
A. otiosa
differs from
A. vialis
in being less than two times longer than wide and lacking anterolateral projections.

Head. Length 0.88–1.18, 1.01 mm . Ocellar tubercle dark reddish brown, pubescence gray, dense; setae dark reddish brown, elongate. Eyes holoptic, separated by distance 0.2 times width of median ocellus; ommatidia smaller ventrally and laterally. Frons pubescence white, dense, dark brown, glabrous on dorsal fourth; setae white (occasionally dark yellow), elongate on ventral three–fourths. Antenna dark brown, scape pubescence gray, dense; antenna/head length 0.69–0.90, 0.81; scape length 0.28–0.42, 0.33 mm , width 0.14–0.16, 0.15 mm , length/width 1.8–2.6, 2.2, scape/pedicel length 2.8–4.3, 3.3, scape/flagellum 0.9–1.1, 1.1 width, setae white, elongate; pedicel length 0.08–0.12, 0.10 mm , width 0.14–0.16, 0.14 mm , length/width 0.6–0.9, 0.7, setae dark brown, short; flagellum length 0.32–0.42, 0.38 mm , width 0.14–0.16, 0.15 mm , length/width 2.1–3.0, 2.7, flagellum/scape length 0.9–1.5, 1.2. Parafacial pubescence white, dense; setae white. Maxillary palpus reddish brown, pubescence white; length 0.36–0.50, 0.45 mm , width 0.08–0.10, 0.10 mm , length/width 3.6–6.3, 4.7; setae white, elongate. Genal setae white, elongate. Occipital setae white, elongate white becoming pale yellow dorsally; macrosetae dark brown (occasionally dark yellow). Postocular macrosetae dark brown (occasionally dark yellow or absent).

Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 1–3 sa, 1 pa, 1–2 dc. Mesonotum with vittae dull brown, separated by gray pubescence; setae white to pale yellow, elongate, subappressed intermixed with dark brown, erect setae. Prosternum setae white. Pleuron pubescence gray, dense; setae white to pale yellow, elongate on propleuron, anepisternum, katepisternum, laterotergite, metanepisternum, and scutellum. Wing. Membrane pale gray, veins and cross-veins brown with brown margin at fork of R 4+5 , r-m, apex of discal cell, apex of cell bm ; length 4.8–6.7, 5.9 mm , width 1.8–2.3, 2.0 mm, length/width 2.2–3.3, 2.8; cell m 3 closed, petiolate. Halter stalk brown, knob pale yellow. Legs. Coxal pubescence silver, dense; setae white, elongate; apical macrosetae dark reddish brown, hindcoxa with 1 posterolateral macroseta. Femora dark reddish brown; ventral setae white, elongate, dorsal appressed setae white. Tibiae dark yellowish brown becoming darker on apical half. Tarsus 1 dark yellow becoming dark reddish brown on apical half; 2–5 dark reddish brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 18–25.
Acrosathe otiosa .
18. Tergite 8, epandrium, cerci. 19. Sternite 8, gonocoxite ventral view. 20. Gonocoxite, lateral view. 21. Gonostylus dorsal view. 22. Aedeagus, dorsal view. 23. Aedeagus, ventral view. 24. Aedeagus, lateral view. 25. Female internal reproductive organs.

subSubSection.paragraph:
FIGURES 26–33.
Acrosathe pacifica .
26. Tergite 8, epandrium, cerci. 27. Sternite 8, gonocoxite ventral view. 28. Gonocoxite, lateral view. 29. Aedeagus, dorsal view. 30. Aedeagus, ventral view. 31. Aedeagus, lateral view. 32. Female head, frontal view. 33. Female internal reproductive organs. Scale = 0.1 mm .
FEMALE. Similar to male except for following. Variation (n=10).

Head. Length 0.90–1.12, 1.02 mm . Frons pubescence white, dense on ventral half, dorsal half dark brown, pubescence brownish gray with large, dark brown circle dorsolaterally (as in Fig. 7 ); setae white to pale yellow, elongate ventrally, dark brown dorsally. Antenna/head length 0.73–0.88, 0.79; scape length 0.30–0.36, 0.33 mm , width 0.14–0.18, 0.15 mm , length/width 1.9–2.6, 2.2, scape/pedicel length 1.9–3.8, 3.4, scape/flagellum width 1.0–1.3, 1.1; pedicel length 0.08–0.12, 0.10 mm , width 0.14 mm , length/width 0.6–0.9, 0.7; flagellum length 0.36–0.42, 0.38 mm , width 0.14 mm , length/width 2.4–3.0, 2.7, flagellum/scape length 0.9–1.3, 1.2. Maxillary palpus length 0.46–0.55, 0.50 mm , width 0.10–0.12, 0.11 mm , length/width 4.3–5.4, 4.8.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3–4, 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 1–2, 2 dc. Wing. Length 5.7–6.7, 6.2 mm , width 1.8–2.3, 2.0 mm, length/width 2.9–3.4, 3.1.

Abdomen. Dark brown, pubescence gray, dense (occasionally absent on anterior fourth of tergites 2 and 3 or tergites 2–4; dorsal setae white to pale yellow appressed.
Terminalia
(MEI 012323). Furca ( Fig. 25 ) narrow, oval; length 0.49 mm , width 0.35 mm ; anterolateral projection absent.

Immature Stages.
One female (MEI 029243) was reared from a larva collected at Great Sand Dunes, Colorado and 2♂ (MEI 012047, 012126) were reared from larvae collected at 1.6 km south of Cantamar , Baja California Norte , Mexico
.

Distribution.
Acrosathe otiosa
is known from British Columbia , Canada , Baja California Norte, Mexico , and California , Colorado , Idaho , Oregon , Washington , Utah , and Wyoming in the United States ( Fig. 52 ).

Habitats and Phenology.
Acrosathe otiosa
has been hand-netted or collected in Malaise traps on sand dunes. Adults have been collected in December and February through August.

Specimens examined. Type specimens.
Coquillett based his description of
Thereva otiosa
on nine males and seven female syntypes from Los Angeles County , California . Only one specimen of these syntypes could be found in USNM collection. This specimen is a male with label 1 on white paper " Los Angeles Co. CAL." (typeset); label 2 on white paper "Apr." (typeset); label three on white paper "Coquillett Collector" (typeset); label 4 on red paper "Type No. 10423 U.S. N.M." (typeset) This male (MEI 159492) is designated as the lectotype of
Thereva otiosa
. This lectotype is designated in order to fix the concept of
T. otiosa
and to ensure universal and consistent interpretation of the same
.
